alert.note: Alert for Modoc (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 4:39AM PDT until March 16 at 3:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Pit River near Canby affecting Modoc County. For the Pit River...including Canby...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pit River near Canby. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Flood stage - Expect minor flooding in Canby Lookout Beiber and Nubeiber California and throughout southwest Modoc and northwest Lassen Counties. 4300 CFS * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 8.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.8 feet on 04/05/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 445 PM PDT.
